00093 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00094 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00095 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00096 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00097 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00098 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00099 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00100 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00101 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00102 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00103 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00104 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00105 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00106 
00107 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00108 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00109 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00110 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00111                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })
00112 
00113 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00114 {
00115     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00116     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00117 }
00118 
00119 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00120                                                  u_long m,
00121                                                  u_long d) {
00122 
00123     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00124     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00125 
00126     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00127     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00128     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00129     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00130     mh += mlh;
00131     qh = mh / d;
00132     r = mh % d;
00133     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00134     ql = ml / d;
00135 
00136     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00137 }
00138 
00139 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00140     if(ll < 0)
00141         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00142     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00143 }
00144 
00145 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00146                                                unsigned long m2) {
00147     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00148 }
00149 
00150 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00151                                                 unsigned long uld,
00152                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00153 {
00154     if (rem)
00155         *rem = ull % uld;
00156 
00157     return ull / uld;
00158 }

00165 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00166 
00167     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00168     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00169     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00170     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00171     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00172     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00173     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00174     pthread_t thid;
00175     xncompletion_t completion;
00176 
00177     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00178        they are set by the nucleus. */
00179     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00180     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00181 
00182 } xnarchtcb_t;

00206 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00207 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00208 
00209 {
00210     char *value;
00211 
00212     if (*ptype == NULL)
00213         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00214 
00215     value = getenv(name);
00216 
00217     if (!value)
00218         return -1;
00219 
00220     if (**ptype == 's')
00221         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00222     else if (strstr(*ptype,"int"))
00223         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00224     else if (strstr(*ptype,"long"))
00225         *((u_long *)pvar) = (u_long)atol(value);
00226 
00227     *ptype = NULL;
00228 
00229     return 1;
00230 }
00231 
00232 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00233 
00234     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00238 
00239     extern int uvm_irqpend;
00240 
00241     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00242         {
00243         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00244             __pthread_release_uvm(&uvm_irqlock);
00245         else
00246             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00247         }
00248 }

00262 int uvm_irqlock = 0;
00263 
00264 int uvm_irqpend = 0;
00265 
00266 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00267 
00268 {
00269     if (uvm_irqlock)
00270         __pthread_hold_uvm(&uvm_irqpend);
00271 }

00334 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00335 
00336     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00337 }
00338 
00339 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00340 
00341 {
00342     struct sigaction sa;
00343     int err;
00344 
00345     if (geteuid() !=0)
00346         {
00347         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00348         exit(1);
00349         }
00350 
00351     err = __fusion_sys_init();
00352 
00353     if (err)
00354         {
00355         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00356         exit(2);
00357         }
00358 
00359     err = __fusion_skin_init();
00360 
00361     if (err)
00362         {
00363         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00364         exit(3);
00365         }
00366 
00367     err = __fusion_user_init();
00368 
00369     if (err)
00370         {
00371         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00372         exit(4);
00373         }
00374 
00375     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00376     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00377     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00378     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00379 
00380     for (;;)
00381         __pthread_idle_uvm(&uvm_irqlock);
00382 
00383     __fusion_user_exit();
00384     __fusion_skin_exit();
00385     __fusion_sys_exit();
00386 
00387     exit(0);
00388 }

00390 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00419 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00420 
00421 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00422 
00423 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00424 
00425 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00426 
00427 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00428 
00429 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00430     unsigned long nstick;
00431     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00432     xncompletion_t completion;
00433 };
00434 
00435 /*
00436  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00437  * defined as follows:
00438  *
00439  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00440  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1
00441  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2
00442  */
00443 
00444 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00445 
00446 {
00447     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00448     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00449     struct sched_param param;
00450     unsigned long nstick;
00451     int err;
00452 
00453     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00454     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00455 
00456     /* Copy the following values laid into our parent's stack before
00457        it is unblocked from the completion by pthread_create_rt(). */
00458     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00459     nstick = p->nstick;
00460 
00461     pthread_create_rt("uvm-timer",NULL,&p->completion,&uvm_timer_handle);
00462 
00463     err = pthread_barrier_rt(); /* Wait for start. */
00464 
00465     if (!err)
00466         err = pthread_set_periodic_rt(0,nstick);
00467 
00468     if (err)
00469         pthread_exit((void *)err);
00470 
00471     for (;;)
00472         {
00473         if (pthread_wait_period_rt() == -EWOULDBLOCK) /* Timer killed? */
00474             break;
00475 
00476         xnarch_sync_irq();
00477         tickhandler();
00478         }
00479 
00480     pthread_exit(NULL);
00481 }
00482 
00483 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00484                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00485 {
00486     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00487     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00488     pthread_t thid;
00489     int err;
00490 
00491     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00492         return -ENODEV;
00493 
00494     /* However, if oneshot timing is available at system level, use it
00495        so that we can provide a better resolution for virtual machine
00496        ticks. Otherwise, ask for plain periodic mode, hoping that the
00497        period given will be compatible with Linux's own requirements
00498        wrt its jiffy-based timer. */
00499 
00500 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER
00501     err = pthread_start_timer_rt(0);
00502 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00503     err = pthread_start_timer_rt(nstick);
00504 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00505 
00506     if (err)
00507         return err;
00508 
00509     parms.nstick = nstick;
00510     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00511     parms.completion.syncflag = 0;
00512     parms.completion.pid = -1;
00513 
00514     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00515     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00516     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00517 
00518     err = pthread_sync_rt(&parms.completion);
00519 
00520     if (err == 0)
00521         pthread_start_rt(uvm_timer_handle);
00522 
00523     return err;
00524 }
00525 
00526 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00527 }
00528 
00529 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00530 }
00531 
00532 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00533                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00534 {
00535     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00536     __pthread_activate_uvm(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00537 }
00538 
00539 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00540                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00541 {
00542     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00543     __pthread_cancel_uvm(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00544 }
00545 
00546 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00547 
00548 {
00549     __pthread_cancel_uvm(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00553                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00554                                          const char *name)
00555 {
00556     struct sched_param param;
00557     int err;
00558 
00559     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00560     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00561     err = pthread_info_rt(&uvm_info);
00562 
00563     if (err)
00564         {
00565         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00566         exit(1);
00567         }
00568 
00569     pthread_init_rt("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00570     tcb->name = name;
00571     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00572 }
00573 
00574 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00575 
00576 {
00577     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00578     struct sched_param param;
00579     int err;
00580 
00581     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00582         {
00583         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00584         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00585         pthread_create_rt(tcb->name,tcb,&tcb->completion,&tcb->khandle);
00586         err = pthread_barrier_rt();     /* Wait for start. */
00587         if (err)
00588             pthread_exit((void *)err);
00589         }
00590 
00591     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00592 
00593     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00594 
00595     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00596 
00597     pthread_exit(NULL);
00598 }
00599 
00600 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00601                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00602                                        void *cookie,
00603                                        int imask,
00604                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00605                                        char *name)
00606 {
00607     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00608 
00609     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00610         {
00611         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00612         return;
00613         }
00614 
00615     tcb->imask = imask;
00616     tcb->entry = entry;
00617     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00618     tcb->thread = thread;
00619     tcb->name = name;
00620     tcb->completion.syncflag = 0;
00621     tcb->completion.pid = -1;
00622 
00623     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00624     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00625     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00626     pthread_sync_rt(&tcb->completion);
00627 }

00645 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00646 
00647 {
00648     spl_t s;
00649     splhigh(s);
00650     splexit(!!imask);
00651     return !!s;
00652 }

00684 extern xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;

00686 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00687 
00688     nanostime_t ns;
00689     return pthread_tsc2ns_rt(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;
00690 }
00691 
00692 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00693 
00694     nanostime_t tsc;
00695     return pthread_ns2tsc_rt(ns,&tsc) ? 0 : tsc;
00696 }
00697 
00698 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00699 
00700 {
00701     nanotime_t t;
00702     pthread_time_rt(&t);
00703     return t;
00704 }
00705 
00706 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void)
00707 
00708 {
00709     nanotime_t t;
00710     pthread_cputime_rt(&t);
00711     return t;
00712 }
00713 
00714 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00715     return uvm_info.cpufreq;
00716 }

00718 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00719     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00720     fflush(stderr);
00721     exit(99);
00722 }

00725     return malloc(bytes);

00729     free(chunk);
